text: good morning guys it's 4:45 a.m. and I
just woke up to come see the fire pit
under the black sky behind me this is
the gas crater we call it the darwaza
service' from turkmen spelling means
gates but also it has the name gates to
help to get here
you must hop in a four-hour car ride
from ash Chabad along the old Silk Road
straight into the Karakum desert the
sand dunes seemingly go on forever and
then all of a sudden our Jeep veered ten
kilometers off the main road and we saw
this an enormous 230 foot crater that's
been continuously raging in flames for
the last 48 years how on earth did this
happen
given that Turkmenistan is rich in
natural gas people have been digging in
the desert to find new sources one day
in 1971 a Soviet scientist dug a little
too fast accidentally making this crater
which collapsed into a gas pocket this
is some of the equipment that they were
using and just buried here in the ground
with natural gas spewing out everywhere
he came up with the genius idea to burn
it all away but it didn't work out as he
expected the fire pit hasn't stopped
burning for the last 17 thousand two
hundred and eighty six days and Counting
the most insane heat wave just fill your
face burning off I'm staying the night
in a yacht a nomadic home just a hundred
meters away from the critter itself
they're preparing me some local Turkmen
dinner tonight
so fresh it's amazing enough to see this
during the day but during the night
it's a scene unlike anything on earth
because darkness in the column desert is
true darkness there's no light pollution
for hundreds of miles only stars above
your head in the pitch black sky putting
on an unthinkable seen here in
Turkmenistan there are very few eternal
fires on this planet but none of them
are as impressive as this one alright
I'm gonna go finish the sunrise catch
